metadata.title: CVE-2023-23455 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
atm_tc_enqueue in net/sched/sch_atm.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.4allows attackers to cause a denial of service because of type confusion(non-negative numbers can sometimes indicate a TC_ACT_SHOT condition ratherthan valid classification results).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic-64k - 5.15.0-69.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1030-kvm - 5.15.0-1030.35
No subscription required

No subscription required
